alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 8:29AM CST until March 04 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Roubidoux Creek Near Waynesville affecting Pulaski County. .Runoff from heavy rainfall received last night and early today will cause the river to rise above flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roubidoux Creek near Waynesville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, low parts of Spring Road south of Business 66 in Waynesville flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 4.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 8.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
